Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2017 ACM Conference on Embedded Networked Sensor Systems (ACM SenSys)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
SenSys, ACM Conference on Embedded Networked Sensor Systems, is a highly selective scientific forum that has successfully created fundamental knowledge and technologies to build the sensors and smart systems, from the wireless sensors in homes and offices to large-scale sensors, networks, and data analytics in smart infrastructures and cities. The conference brings together researchers from the fields of wireless communication and networking, embedded systems and hardware, energy harvesting and management, distributed systems and algorithms, data management, and applications and thus is an ideal venue for beginning researchers and PhD students to get to know the field from disciplinary and cross-disciplinary perspectives. The goal of this project is to provide funding for attending SenSys 2017 by PhD students who are enrolled in the US institutions of higher learning. The project will enable students who are not well-funded or who belong to underrepresented groups to attend SenSys. The students will not only gain exposure to the leading researchers in the field but also network with peers and start research collaborations as they take leadership roles in research.

This project will enable approximately 17 Ph.D. students from recognized US institution of higher education to attend SenSys 2017 and its co-located events. A grant selection committee will select the participants based on their financial need, research potential, and their ability to benefit from this attendance while increasing diversity among SenSys attendees. SenSys and the field of sensing and smart systems will benefit from this increased diversity and engagement from the US-based PhD students. The students will benefit from exposure to the leading researchers in the field and with increased networking and collaboration opportunities at SenSys.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The project successfully enabled 16 graduate students from US-based institutions of higher education to participate in 2017 ACM Conference on Embedded Networked Sensor Systems (ACM SenSys) and its co-located events. The event not only provided the participants to learn about research in the field but also the opportunity to develop network for research collaborations as they progress in their research and career. The project also contributed to increased diversity among the attendees at the conference: some of the awardees were from among minority groups and some institutions are Hispanic Serving Institutions. The ACM SenSys 2017 program included refereed paper presentations on topics including networking, deep learning, healthcare, novel communication media, localization and tracking, human sensing, energy management, innovative sensing, and security and privacy. The conference also had poster and demo sessions and five workshops, a doctoral school, and a doctoral colloquium. Thus, the students got an opportunity for comprehensive engagement with the research community and get feedback on their research. The testimonials from the participants demonstrate the positive impact the conference had in shaping their research by interacting with the senior researchers in the field (both from academia and industry) and their peers from other universities in the US and from around the world.
